title: AtoZ CSS News
tag_line: My favourite articles and news plus a new CSS tip
intro_text: I've been getting back into screencasting mode recently (see below...) and of course, I've also been scouring the web for all sorts of interesting articles for your reading pleasure. Enjoy!

news.link_comment: I mostly write Sass but on occasion, a contract might call for using Less or Stylus. If you need to level up in Less, 10 minutes sounds like a pretty enticing value proposition!

news.link_text: Can I Use from the Command Line
news.link_comment: This tool is really useful! I'm often searching for browser support over at caniuse.com but with this handy Node package, I can get the info I need without leaving my local development environment.
If OOCSS, SMACSS and BEM or AtomicOOBEMITSCSS don't float your boat, how about Oxygen? An object orientated methodology for CSS.
This Codepen features 10 funky little icons made entirely with CSS. I particularly like the little border-radius highlights - a great proof of concept.
To Do apps are usually the realm of JavaScript tutorials but here, Will demonstrates how checkboxes can make a pure CSS to-do app. Pretty clever stuff!

Finally, I've recently teamed up with Tuts+ to create my first video course for them. The course is very practical and goes step by step through the process of building a simple portfolio site with Jekyll, Markdown, Liquid, Git and Sass. This is a paid course and as a Tuts+ affiliate, I'll earn a small commission for anyone who signs up to watch. Thanks in advance!
